topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack(R) Carrier Grade (Beta): Rebooting Instances

body.p: You can soft or hard reboot a running instance.
With a soft reboot, the operating system is signaled to restart, which allows for a graceful shutdown of all processes. A hard reboot is the equivalent of power cycling the server.

li.p: Launch the HP Helion OpenStack(R) Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Project dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to modify, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Soft Reboot Instance or Hard Reboot Instance.
In the confirmation screen, click Soft Reboot Instance or Hard Reboot Instance.
The progress of the reboot is displayed in the Task column on the Instances screen.
